trans-unit.source: Using redirection in Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Using redirection in Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure and use redirection in RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure and use redirection in RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Using redirection in Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Using redirection in Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Device redirection lets your users interact with remote apps using the devices attached to their local computer, phone, or tablet.
trans-unit.target: Device redirection lets your users interact with remote apps using the devices attached to their local computer, phone, or tablet.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have provided Skype through Azure RemoteApp, your user needs the camera installed on their PC to work with Skype.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have provided Skype through Azure RemoteApp, your user needs the camera installed on their PC to work with Skype.

trans-unit.source: This is also true for printers, speakers, monitors, and a range of USB-connected peripherals.
trans-unit.target: This is also true for printers, speakers, monitors, and a range of USB-connected peripherals.

trans-unit.source: RemoteApp leverages the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and RemoteFX to provide redirection.
trans-unit.target: RemoteApp leverages the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and RemoteFX to provide redirection.

trans-unit.source: What redirection is enabled by default?
trans-unit.target: What redirection is enabled by default?

trans-unit.source: When you use RemoteApp, the following redirections are enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: When you use RemoteApp, the following redirections are enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: The information in parentheses show the RDP setting.
trans-unit.target: The information in parentheses show the RDP setting.

trans-unit.source: Play sounds on the local computer (**Play on this computer**).
trans-unit.target: Play sounds on the local computer (**Play on this computer**).

trans-unit.source: (audiomode:i:0)
trans-unit.target: (audiomode:i:0)

trans-unit.source: Capture audio from the local computer and send to the remote computer (**Record from this computer**).
trans-unit.target: Capture audio from the local computer and send to the remote computer (**Record from this computer**).

trans-unit.source: (audiocapturemode:i:1)
trans-unit.target: (audiocapturemode:i:1)

trans-unit.source: Print to local printers (redirectprinters:i:1)
trans-unit.target: Print to local printers (redirectprinters:i:1)

trans-unit.source: COM ports (redirectcomports:i:1)
trans-unit.target: COM ports (redirectcomports:i:1)

trans-unit.source: Smart card device (redirectsmartcards:i:1)
trans-unit.target: Smart card device (redirectsmartcards:i:1)

trans-unit.source: Clipboard (ability to copy and paste) (redirectclipboard:i:1)
trans-unit.target: Clipboard (ability to copy and paste) (redirectclipboard:i:1)

trans-unit.source: Clear type font smoothing (allow font smoothing:i:1)
trans-unit.target: Clear type font smoothing (allow font smoothing:i:1)

trans-unit.source: Redirect all supported Plug and Play devices.
trans-unit.target: Redirect all supported Plug and Play devices.

trans-unit.source: (devicestoredirect:s:*)
trans-unit.target: (devicestoredirect:s:*)

trans-unit.source: What other redirection is available?
trans-unit.target: What other redirection is available?

trans-unit.source: Two redirection options are disabled by default:
trans-unit.target: Two redirection options are disabled by default:

trans-unit.source: Drive redirection (drive mapping): Your local computer's drives become mapped drives in the remote session.
trans-unit.target: Drive redirection (drive mapping): Your local computer's drives become mapped drives in the remote session.

trans-unit.source: This lets you save or open files from your local drives while you work in the remote session.
trans-unit.target: This lets you save or open files from your local drives while you work in the remote session.

trans-unit.source: USB redirection: You can use the USB devices attached to your local computer within the remote session.
trans-unit.target: USB redirection: You can use the USB devices attached to your local computer within the remote session.

trans-unit.source: Change your redirection settings in RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Change your redirection settings in RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: You can change the device redirection settings for a collection by using the Microsoft Azure PowerShell with SDK.
trans-unit.target: You can change the device redirection settings for a collection by using the Microsoft Azure PowerShell with SDK.

trans-unit.source: After you install the new PowerShell and SDK, first configure it to manage your subscription as described in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: After you install the new PowerShell and SDK, first configure it to manage your subscription as described in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Then use a command similar to the following to set the custom RDP properties:
trans-unit.target: Then use a command similar to the following to set the custom RDP properties:

trans-unit.source: (Note that *`n* is used as a delimiter between individual properties.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that *`n* is used as a delimiter between individual properties.)

trans-unit.source: To get a list of what custom RDP properties are configured, run the following cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To get a list of what custom RDP properties are configured, run the following cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Note that only custom properties are shown as output results and not the default properties:
trans-unit.target: Note that only custom properties are shown as output results and not the default properties:

trans-unit.source: When you set custom properties you must specify all custom properties each time; otherwise the setting reverts to disabled.
trans-unit.target: When you set custom properties you must specify all custom properties each time; otherwise the setting reverts to disabled.

trans-unit.source: Common examples
trans-unit.target: Common examples

trans-unit.source: Use the following cmdlet to enable drive redirection:
trans-unit.target: Use the following cmdlet to enable drive redirection:

trans-unit.source: Use this cmdlet to enable both USB and Drive redirection:
trans-unit.target: Use this cmdlet to enable both USB and Drive redirection:

trans-unit.source: Use this cmdlet to disable clipboard sharing:
trans-unit.target: Use this cmdlet to disable clipboard sharing:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Be sure to completely log off all users in the collection (and not just disconnect them) before you test the change.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Be sure to completely log off all users in the collection (and not just disconnect them) before you test the change.

trans-unit.source: To ensure users are completely logged off, go to the **Sessions** tab in the collection in the Azure portal and log off any users who are disconnected or signed in.
trans-unit.target: To ensure users are completely logged off, go to the **Sessions** tab in the collection in the Azure portal and log off any users who are disconnected or signed in.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it can take several seconds for the local drives to show in Explorer within the session.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes it can take several seconds for the local drives to show in Explorer within the session.

trans-unit.source: Change USB redirection settings on your Windows client
trans-unit.target: Change USB redirection settings on your Windows client

trans-unit.source: If you want to use USB redirection on a computer that connects to RemoteApp, there are 2 actions that need to happen.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use USB redirection on a computer that connects to RemoteApp, there are 2 actions that need to happen.

trans-unit.source: 1 - Your administrator needs to enable USB redirection at the collection level by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: 1 - Your administrator needs to enable USB redirection at the collection level by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: 2 - On each device where you want to use USB redirection, you need to enable a group policy that permits it.
trans-unit.target: 2 - On each device where you want to use USB redirection, you need to enable a group policy that permits it.

trans-unit.source: This step will need to be done for each user that wants to use USB redirection.
trans-unit.target: This step will need to be done for each user that wants to use USB redirection.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] USB redirection with Azure RemoteApp is only supported for Windows computers.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] USB redirection with Azure RemoteApp is only supported for Windows computers.

trans-unit.source: Enable USB redirection for the RemoteApp collection
trans-unit.target: Enable USB redirection for the RemoteApp collection

trans-unit.source: Use the following cmdlet to enable USB redirection at the collection level:
trans-unit.target: Use the following cmdlet to enable USB redirection at the collection level:

trans-unit.source: Enable USB redirection for the client computer
trans-unit.target: Enable USB redirection for the client computer

trans-unit.source: To configure USB redirection settings on your computer:
trans-unit.target: To configure USB redirection settings on your computer:

trans-unit.source: Open the Local Group Policy Editor (GPEDIT.MSC).
trans-unit.target: Open the Local Group Policy Editor (GPEDIT.MSC).

trans-unit.source: (Run gpedit.msc from a command prompt.)
trans-unit.target: (Run gpedit.msc from a command prompt.)

trans-unit.source: Open **Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Connection Client\RemoteFX USB Device Redirection**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Connection Client\RemoteFX USB Device Redirection**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click **Allow RDP redirection of other supported RemoteFX USB devices from this computer**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click **Allow RDP redirection of other supported RemoteFX USB devices from this computer**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Enabled**, and then select **Administrators and Users in the RemoteFX USB Redirection Access Rights**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Enabled**, and then select **Administrators and Users in the RemoteFX USB Redirection Access Rights**.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt with administrative permissions, and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt with administrative permissions, and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Restart the computer.
trans-unit.target: Restart the computer.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Group Policy Management tool to create and apply the USB redirection policy for all computers in your domain:
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Group Policy Management tool to create and apply the USB redirection policy for all computers in your domain:

trans-unit.source: Log into the domain controller as the domain administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log into the domain controller as the domain administrator.

trans-unit.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console.
trans-unit.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console.

trans-unit.source: (Click **Start > Administrative Tools > Group Policy Management**.)
trans-unit.target: (Click **Start > Administrative Tools > Group Policy Management**.)

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the domain or organizational unit for which you want to create the policy.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the domain or organizational unit for which you want to create the policy.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Default Domain Policy**, and then click **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Default Domain Policy**, and then click **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: Open **Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Connection Client\RemoteFX USB Device Redirection**.
trans-unit.target: Open **Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Connection Client\RemoteFX USB Device Redirection**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click **Allow RDP redirection of other supported RemoteFX USB devices from this computer**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click **Allow RDP redirection of other supported RemoteFX USB devices from this computer**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Enabled**, and then select **Administrators and Users in the RemoteFX USB Redirection Access Rights**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Enabled**, and then select **Administrators and Users in the RemoteFX USB Redirection Access Rights**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.
